referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Multiplication
referralLink.description: Are you ready for DKT test? Try simulation test before you go for final test.

referralLink.title: Simple Arithematic questions on Substraction
referralLink.description: Government website for all informationunder one umbrella.

options: Stop, if you see a car with its right-hand indicator on.
Check for parked vehicles with turn signals on, or children about to step out.
Sound your horn and flash your headlights to warn drivers not to pull out.
questions.qn: When driving near parked vehicles, you should -

options: If you do not have a clear view of any approaching traffic.
If you cannot see clear road ahead for 100 metres.
If you cannot see clear road ahead for 75 metres.
questions.qn: You are approaching a hill or curve. You must not cross the centre line to overtake -

options: Flash your headlights to warn oncoming traffic.
Keep to the left and slow down.
Increase your speed and sound your horn.
questions.qn: You are approaching the crest (top of a hill) on a narrow road, the safest procedure is to -

options: The other vehicle is going slower than you.
You are travelling at more than 80 km/h.
The other vehicle is turning right.
questions.qn: On a single laned road (as shown), you must always overtake another vehicle on its right except when -

options: The driver of the vehicle signals it is safe to do so.
An oncoming car appears over a hill.
You can see the overtaken vehicle in your rear vision mirror.
questions.qn: When overtaking another vehicle you should NOT move back in front of it, unless -

options: Keep to the left and let that driver overtake you.
Speed up so that the driver will not have to overtake.
Signal the driver to remain behind you if it is travelling too fast.
questions.qn: A driver behind you signals their intention to overtake your car. What should you do?

options: Less time you need to overtake.
More distance and time you need to overtake
Closer you must get before starting to overtake.
questions.qn: The faster the vehicle in front of you is travelling, the -

options: Wait for a better opportunity with more distance to overtake.
Put the vehicle in a lower gear and speed up.
Sound your horn to signal the driver ahead to slow down.
questions.qn: If you are not sure you have enough distance to overtake a vehicle ahead, you should -

options: Move to the left and stop.
Brake quickly to let the other vehicle overtake.
Keep left and allow plenty of room to let the other vehicle back in.
questions.qn: When being overtaken by another vehicle what should you do to help?

options: Sound your horn, move out andovertake.
Check to see it is safe, change gear if necessary, and signal your intention before moving out.
Signal and slow down so you will have more room to overtake.
questions.qn: Before beginning to overtake another vehicle, you should -

options: Must let the long vehicle turn first.
Maymove to the left-hand side of the road and pass the long vehicle.
May pass the truck because it cannot turn leftfrom the middle lane.
questions.qn: You are driving behind a long vehicle (as shown) which has a sign saying DO NOT OVERTAKE TURNING VEHICLE. The long vehicle indicates that it is going to turn left. You -

options: The same as you would another car, with safety.
Drive as close as possible to thecyclist so he or she will move over and let you pass
Sound your horn to warn the cyclistto get off the road.
questions.qn: How should you overtake a pedal cyclist?

options: Flash your lights at the overtaking vehicle.
Speed up and not let the vehicle back in.
Prepare to slow down to allow room.
questions.qn: If an overtaking vehicle signals that it must move in, in front of you, you should -

options: Sound your horn.
Make sure it is safe and the way is clear of oncoming traffic.
Increase your speed.
questions.qn: The first thing you should do before overtaking is -

options: Be sent to prison.
Be restricted to driving an automatic vehicle.
Have a personal speed limit imposed on you.
questions.qn: If you are convicted of driving with a blood alcohol level that is over the limit for your licence, you could lose your driver's licence. You may also -

options: You could be given demerit points only.
You could only be fined and given demerit points.
You could lose your licence and may be sent to prison.
questions.qn: If you are convicted of dangerous driving -

options: Driven too slowly.
Crossed an unbroken lane line.
Changed lanes unnecessarily
questions.qn: You are travelling in the left lane and wish to turn right at the intersection. You move to the right lane and a driver behind sounds their horn at you. What have you done wrong?

options: Overtaking on the kerb side.
Not signalling to change lanes.
Crossing an unbroken line at a curve.
questions.qn: What is this driver doing that is negligent and illegal?

options: Move into the left lane.
Keep your position in this lane.
Accelerate away from the other vehicle and keep driving in this lane.
questions.qn: The speed limit on this road is 90 km/h. You have just overtaken a vehicle in the left lane. What should you do next?

options: When there is no other traffic around.
Whenever you want to.
Only when overtaking or turning right.
questions.qn: The speed limit on this road is 100 km/h. When can you use the right lane?
